#summary The Wait action is used to space out a sequence by some duration.
#labels Actions
=Wait=
==Summary==
This [AbstractSynchronizedAction action] simply waits for the duration specified then ends. It can be used for spacing out time in a [Sequence].

==Syntax==
{{{
new Wait(waitTime:*)
}}}
  * `waitTime` - The wait time (offset)

==Example==
Creates a [Sequence] that moves a square from left to right, uses Wait to pause for 2 seconds, then moves the square from right to left.

[http://mimswright.com/kitchensync/demo/wait/ View demo]

{{{
package
{
	import com.mimswright.easing.*;
	import com.mimswright.sync.*;
	
	import flash.display.Sprite;
	
	public class WaitDemo extends Sprite
	{
		public function WaitDemo() {
			Synchronizer.initialize(this);
			
			// Draw a rectangle to use for demonstrations.
			var sprite:Sprite = new Sprite();
			sprite.graphics.beginFill(0);
			sprite.graphics.drawRect(0,0,20,20);
			addChild(sprite);
			
			// Tween the rectangle from 0 to 300 over 4 seconds.
			var tween:Tween = new Tween(sprite, "x", 300, 0, "3s", "0s", Cubic.easeInOut);
			// Duplicate the tween in reverse.
			var tween2:Tween = tween.cloneReversed();
			
			// add a 2 second pause after the square moves before returning it back to it's start position.
			var group:Sequence = new Sequence(tween, new Wait("2s"), tween2);
			group.start();
		}
	}
}
}}}
